meanings.definition: The theory that living organisms can only arise from other living organisms.
meanings.sent1: According to biogeny, living things come from other living things.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study biogeny to understand how life forms originate.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with laughter when the teacher explained biogeny with a puppet show.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of nature, biogeny is the seed from which all life blooms.
meanings.sent5: The concept of biogeny is like a chain linking one living being to another in a never-ending cycle.

meanings.definition: The study of the origin and development of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Biogeny involves exploring how living things first appeared on Earth.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use biogeny to trace the evolution of different species.
meanings.sent3: The children's book on biogeny was both educational and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: In the vast library of nature, biogeny is the oldest and most fascinating book.
meanings.sent5: The journey of biogeny is like a map leading us through the history of life on our planet.
